page.title: 11EDUCATION IN DELABOLE
page.content: {Delabole C.P. School}was opened in 1879 as three separate schools:boys', girls'and infants'. The three school Houses, which compete for sports, are named after{the first {three Head teachers:}William Martin, Emily Edwards and Annie Williams. The schools were amalgamated in 1920 and remained an all-age school until 1962 when Sir James Smith's Grammar school in Camelford moved into new buildings and became a{Comprehensive school taking all children over the age of 11 from the Camelford area. Delabole C.P. School now has 82 {children on roll}in three classes. The teachers are Mr.Barker,Mrs.Soulsby, Mrs.Richardson and Mrs.Hopkins. Children's{favourite subjects are English(27 votes) Maths(22 votes) P.E.(10 votes) and Art(5 votes).
